metadata.synopsis: Laezel reaction from seeing Vlaakith in camp and accepting or refusing her mission
metadata.how_to_trigger: After Laezel Camp night: Act3 -> VlaakithVisit

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: It is done. My faith is acknowledged, my destiny set in slate.

91.speaker: Lae'zel
91.text: 'Vlaakith's mercy is as rare as the disciple who earns it.'

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.text: My queen, my eternal regent. Through your eternal wisdom, I will be legend!
47.context: NodeContext: Spoken with triumph. Said to the heavens as if Vlaakith were there

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Do not let your pride lead to vanity. You must act for Vlaakith's glory, not your own.

48.speaker: Lae'zel
48.text: Wise words, kin - and so it must be. As Baht t'Vlaakith, I shall still be bound to all ten-thousand protocols.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Lae'zel of K'liir, I honour your conviction. Vlaakith gha'g shkath zai!

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Don't get ahead of yourself. Orpheus isn't dead yet.

101.speaker: Lae'zel
101.text: Chk. I have seen my future in the shimmering visage of my queen, heard it in her thundering voice.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I'm proud of you. You've proved your loyalty at every step.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: You found your way back to Vlaakith. I'm proud of you.

72.speaker: Lae'zel
72.text: Let us bathe in our pride, then - but for just a moment. Pride turns to vanity if left too long fester.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I shudder to think what would happen if you fail her now.
79.context:
NodeContext: VLAH-kith gawg shkaath ZAI!

Spoken with triumph.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: Waste no time thinking about what won't come to pass.
36.context:
NodeContext: VLAH-kith gawg shkaath ZAI!

Spoken with triumph.

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: Orpheus will fall. And I will have my just rewards.
41.context:
NodeContext: VLAH-kith gawg shkaath ZAI!

Spoken with triumph.

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: Vlaakith gha'g shkath zai. Zai, zai, zai!
30.context:
NodeContext: VLAH-kith gawg shkaath ZAI!

Spoken with triumph.

8.speaker: Lae'zel
8.text: O! queen, you've heard my cries. Now, I heed your sacred mission.
8.context: NodeContext: Calling out to th eheavens

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: I will take the key from Voss' contact in the city. And I will free the prince so I might cleave him from brain to belly.
21.context: NodeContext: Calling out to the heavens

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.context:
NodeContext: cheh-MAR ZAL-ah VLAH-kith

Calling out to the heavens

39.speaker: Lae'zel
39.text: I will hammer Orpheus free from his chains. And I will cleave him from brain to belly.
39.context: NodeContext: Calling out to the heavens

50.speaker: Lae'zel
50.text: I will take the Orphic Hammer from Raphael's lair. The prince will be freed, so I might cleave him from brain to belly.
50.context: NodeContext: Calling out to the heavens

98.speaker: Lae'zel
98.text: Voss waits at Sharess' Caress. I will retrieve the key that binds Orpheus - and then cleave him from brain to belly.
98.context: NodeContext: Calling out to the heavens

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: First, we find a way to free Orpheus from his astral chains. Then, we cleave him from brain to belly.
70.context: NodeContext: Calling out to the heavens

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.text: I have seen my future in the shimmering visage of my queen, heard it in her thundering voice.

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: You turned my eyes to the truth. My faith is acknowledged, my destiny set in slate.
61.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

93.speaker: Lae'zel
93.text: You turned my eyes to the truth. Vlaakith's forsaken me - and there's no going back.
93.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

96.speaker: Lae'zel
96.text: As long as the Undying Queen reigns, I am never to soar unbound over the Astral Sea, never to cross the One in the Void.
96.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: As it should be. Better a short life built on truth than immortality woven of lies.
6.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

1.speaker: Lae'zel
1.text: Better to unite the githyanki under a prince who would free their minds and honour their bodies.
1.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: So why do I feel so bitter?
11.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: You're grieving the future you'll never have. Vlaakith took everything from you.
100.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, but gaining confidence.

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.text: How well you've come to know me.
19.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, but gaining confidence.

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: But in truth, she didn't take everything.

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: I have what I have gathered for myself. I'm moored to a new regent, a new land, and new allies.

75.speaker: Lae'zel
75.text: I am known and honoured by you, the source of my bruises - and the source of my joy.

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: I am known and honoured by you, the source of my bruises.

37.speaker: Lae'zel
37.text: Vlaakith cannot un-make she who no longer exists.
37.context: NodeContext: Fully confident, with particular pleased emphasis

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Connect with Lae'zel's parasite and explore the furthest reaches of her emotions.
89.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *Loss. It permeates every corner of Lae'zel's mind. Everything she knew to be true, every plan and aspiration she ever held, has been painfully ripped away.*

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *Loss. It permeates every corner of Lae'zel's mind. Everything she knew to be true, every plan and aspiration she ever held, has been painfully ripped away.*

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *Lae'zel's bitterness is born of sadness. She is mourning the loss of the person she once was, and can never be again.*

25.text: *Lae'zel has been ostracised by your queen. Why should she not feel bitter?*

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *Lae'zel has been ostracised by her queen. Why should she not feel bitter?*

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Consider Lae'zel's past and present. What is the true source of her resentment?
49.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

68.text: *Vlaakith has upended Lae'zel's whole existence. Everything she knew to be true, every plan and aspiration she ever held, has been painfully ripped away.*

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *Vlaakith has upended Lae'zel's whole existence. Everything she knew to be true, every plan and aspiration she ever held, has been painfully ripped away.*

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Your own regent is terrorising you. You have good reason to hate her.
86.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

54.speaker: Lae'zel
54.text: I know hate. It seethes and distils into molten rock, forever rattling in the belly.
54.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: But I've never known this. I feel no heat, no cold; I bear neither fangs nor talon. There is only... absence.
14.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: No matter. I am Vlaakith's child no more. I have been born anew in Gith's son, my saviour.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Ignore it, and keep faith in Orpheus. He'll give you everything you wanted.

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: Yes. From doubt rises certainty: Orpheus, the Prince of the Comet. He is living truth, undeniable.

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: I will have a home in Tu'narath yet, and Orpheus will be the light that guides me there.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Because Voss told you the truth, and you slayed him for it.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: So I did. I have no excuse, and I deserve no forgiveness.

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.text: But this, I pledge: to honour Voss through my dedication to our shared cause - Orpheus' freedom, and Vlaakith's destruction.

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: I have been born anew in Gith's son, my saviour.

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: And so from the old battle cries is birthed another:

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.text: Ch'mar, zal'a Orpheus. Mha stil'na forjun inyeri!
83.context:
NodeContext: Fully confident

cheh-MAR ZAL-a OR-fee-us. Mah STILL-na FOR-jun in-YARE-ee!

82.speaker: Lae'zel
82.text: Orpheus' will above all. May the Comet blaze my path forward!

69.speaker: Player
69.text: You've been quick to pledge yourself to Orpheus' cause. What about your own needs and wants?

58.speaker: Lae'zel
58.text: Orpheus' freedom is my want and my need. To deny his freedom would be to deny my own.

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: There will come a time when I can think about myself beyond the lich queen who enslaves the githyanki and the prince who would liberate them.

12.speaker: Lae'zel
12.text: But that time won't come until the Prince of the Comet flies again.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Vlaakith promised to make you Baht t'Vlaakith. An incredible honour.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Vlaakith promised to make you Baht t'Vlaakith. Sounds impressive.

77.speaker: Lae'zel
77.text: Vlaakith's left hand, and her right - commander of all dragons, Chosen of the Queen Regent.

32.speaker: Lae'zel
32.text: Not since Vlaakith-One has a Baht t'Vlaakith been anointed.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: Another empty promise. Only a naive fool would believe otherwise. The kind of fool I was not so long ago.

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: Once Orpheus is slain, I will take my place in Castle Susurrus as Baht t'Vlaakith the second.

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: Every githyanki, and every red dragon, shall know me by the name.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: We find Voss' contact in Sharess' Caress. They alone hold the key to freeing the prince. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

2.speaker: Lae'zel
2.text: We hammer Orpheus free from his chains at our first chance. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.text: Raphael knows how we can free Orpheus. We must see him at once. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: We take the Orphic Hammer from Raphael's lair. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

20.speaker: Lae'zel
20.text: We find Voss at Sharess' Caress and retrieve the key to releasing the prince. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

78.speaker: Lae'zel
78.text: We find Voss in the Sharess' Caress taproom. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: We find a way to free Orpheus from his astral chains. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I can't explain how you feel, Lae'zel.

29.speaker: Lae'zel
29.text: Chk. Then the feeling will fade like Vlaakith's craven projection.

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: I am her child no more. I have been born anew in Gith's son, my saviour.

94.speaker: Lae'zel
94.text: It is done. There is no going back.
94.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.
